This innovation addresses a critical business need, enabling companies to better understand and manage cost factors that influence product profitability and company contribution margins.

UCB will continuously replace the existing product costing capability with an innovative and streamlined solution tailored for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. 

We have collected the most relevant sources of information for you here in a new SAP Community Page - including detailed blog posts, getting started information, KBAs, Learnings and more:

entry.title: Consuming your own (or external) Web Components in UI5 Applications
entry.content:
Consuming your own (or external) Web Components in UI5 Applications

This post summarizes my learnings on how to consume arbitrary web components natively in UI5 applications. This is a powerful alternative to UI5 custom controls, since web components are framework-agnostic and can be reused in other contexts as well.

A lot of people perceive UI5 as a control library only, or at least a frontend framework that is very closely tied to its control library, but it's actually much more than that. It's a very powerful and flexible framework that can be extended and used in many different ways.

During the Developer Keynote at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 2025 (no online recording unfortunately), I demoed the flexibility and openness of UI5 by showing two approaches for extending UI5 application with custom elements:

The first approach has been around for quite a while and is well known: developing UI5 custom controls. With this approach, you essentially create new UI5 controls by extending existing UI5 controls. This approach has the advantage of being fully integrated into the UI5 framework, but it also means it is tightly coupled to UI5. You cannot reuse UI5 custom controls for applications that are not based on UI5. However, since third-party packages (e.g. from npm) can be consumend inside UI5 applications as well (see ui5-tooling-modules), this approach is by no means limited. Check out this repository for detailed instructions on how to build a UI5 custom control that renders a 3D model of a supermarket to guide customers to a product's location: ui5-advanced-exercises-codejam

The second approach is very new to UI5: building your own web components and consuming them natively in UI5 applications. This approach is framework-agnostic, as the technologies that make up web components are open web standards. This means you can (re)use the same web components in any web application, regardless of the framework. Think of whole design systems that could be built using this approach, and then be reused in UI5/React/Angular/Vue applications alike! This blog post focuses on this second approach.

To demonstrate this capability, we first need a web component. For the sake of simplicity, I created a very basic web component that displays a button, and when clicked, shows an alert. The code for the web component looks like this:

class CustomAlertButton extends HTMLElement {

    static get observedAttributes() {
        return [
            "text",
            "message"
        ]
    }

    attributeChangedCallback(name, oldValue, newValue) {
        this.render()
    }

    constructor() {
        super()

        /**
         * Sets the button's text.
         * @default "Show Alert"
         * @public
         */
        this.text = "Show Alert"

        /**
         * Sets the alert message.
         * @default ""
         * @public
         */
        this.message = ""

        this.attachShadow({ mode: "open" })
        this.render()
    }

    render() {
        const text = this.getAttribute("text") || this.text
        const message = this.getAttribute("message") || this.message
        let button
        if (!this.shadowRoot.querySelector("button")) {
            button = document.createElement("button")
            this.shadowRoot.appendChild(button)
        } else {
            button = this.shadowRoot.querySelector("button")
            button.textContent = text
            if (message) {
                button.addEventListener("click", async () => {
                    alert(message)
                })
            }
        }
    }
}

customElements.define("custom-alert-button", CustomAlertButton)

There are two things important to note regarding the implementation above:

  1. For some reason I don't fully understand yet, the render method of the web component will get executed three times when the component is first rendered in a UI5 application. Therefore, the method includes some conditional logic to avoid adding multiple buttons or event handlers to the shadow DOM.
  2. The static getter observedAttributes as well as the JSDoc comments in the constructor method are mandatory in order for UI5 to be able to recognize the web component correctly and integrate it into its data binding and property system. Furthermore, we have to generate a custom-elements.js manifest file that describes the web component's API. This can be done using the @custom-elements-manifest/analyzer package. After installing it as a dev dependency, you can run the following command to generate the manifest file:
custom-elements-manifest analyze

This will create a custom-elements.json file in the root of your project. The file tree of your custom web component package should now look like this:

custom-webc-package/
|-- custom-elements.js
|-- CustomAlertButton.js
|-- package.json

With the custom web component package ready, we can now consume it in a UI5 application. To do so, we first need to install it as a dependency. In the package.json of the UI5 application, add it as a dependency and run npm install afterwards:

...
{
  "dependencies": {
    "custom-webc-package": "file:<path-to-your-custom-webc-package>"
  }
}
...

At this point you might be thinking "wait, I can just declare any package as a dependency and use it in UI5?!" - and the answer is yes, with the help of the ui5-tooling-modules package, which allows you to consume arbitrary npm packages in UI5 applications. So make sure you have it set up in your UI5 application.

Now that the custom web component package is installed, its consumption is very straightforward. Simply declare a namespace in an XML view that points to the package, and use the web component like any other UI5 control:

<mvc:View
    ...
    xmlns:webc="custom-webc-package">
    ...
    <webc:custom-alert-button
        text="Click Me!"
        message="Hello from my custom web component!" />
    ...

Now, to top off this exmaple, one more thing worth mentioning: In our web component implementation, we can even import and use other web components, for example UI5 web components. The UI5 web components have the same look and feel as the standard UI5 controls, but they are built on top of web component technologies, so they too are framework-agnostic (just like our own custom web component). In our example, we can replace the standard HTML button with the ui5-button web component from the UI5 web components library:

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Button.js"

class CustomAlertButton extends HTMLElement {

    ...

    render() {
        const text = this.getAttribute("text") || this.text
        const message = this.getAttribute("message") || this.message
        let button
        if (!this.shadowRoot.querySelector("ui5-button")) {
            button = document.createElement("ui5-button")
            this.shadowRoot.appendChild(button)
        } else {
            button = this.shadowRoot.querySelector("ui5-button")
            button.textContent = text
            if (message) {
                button.addEventListener("click", async () => {
                    alert(message)
                })
            }
        }
    }
}

customElements.define("custom-alert-button", CustomAlertButton)

We have now come full-circle: We created a custom web component, which by design is framework-agnostic, and used a UI5 web component inside of it. We consumed the custom web component in a UI5 application, demonstrating the flexibility and openness of the UI5 framework, and we could take this same web component to any other application as well, be it UI5 or not.

Try it out yourself and let me know how it goes!

entry.title: Re: Use Datastore to avoid too many duplicate MPL attachments in exception retries
entry.content:
In those scenarios, you can still have automatic retries from the DLQ DataStore pushed to the original queue, but with less frequent retry intervals to avoid overloading the system (as a good alternative to JMS exponential backoff). 

On the other hand, there are no hard limits for MPL attachments in Cloud Foundry (number, size of single attachment, not using tenant DB size but BTP object store) as per note: 3380591. Anyway, saving attachments to DataStore can help smooth out the process and is definitely worth considering if you chose unlimited/high number of retries.

For downtime handling, this blog is quite useful
https://community.sap.com/t5/integration-blog-posts/add-sap-pi-po-communication-channel-start-stop-functionality-to-your-iflows/ba-p/14115643

although it's only a workaround - standard start/stop feature like in PI/PO is unfortunately still missing.

 

br

Mateusz

entry.title: Re: Packaging Instruction Determination Not Triggering Di...
entry.content: Hello @Chris1973, Thank you for your reply, but I cannot rely on the SAPGUI-style packaging instruction because in EWM we use packaging specifications. The customizing point I am referring to (Maintain Packing Transaction Profile) states: In each profile, the following parameters are set: â€¢ Display mode or change mode for handling unit (HU) proposals during packing â€¢ The procedure used to automatically determine packing instructions â€¢ Whether the system expands packing instructions automatically when materials and quantities are entered or changed â€¢ Whether the system displays a selection dialog box during the automatic expansion process, so the user can choose a packing instruction from those proposed by the system (main or alternative packing instruction) â€¢ Whether the system considers rounding and minimum quantities in the automatic expansion process â€¢ Whether the system also considers alternative packing instructions in automatic expansion, if the main packing instruction cannot pack the required quantity From this, I understand that there should be a way to open a dialog to select the instruction manually. Sometimes there is no clear criterion to define an order; it is simply one option or the other because the material can arrive in two different forms. The determination records are correct, as I mentioned. My issue is that the dialog for manual selection of the alternative does not appear. The same happens with Packing Transaction Profile 0021 â€“ Sync. GR from Production in EWM via MIGO: even though the dialog flag is set, the dialog does not show up. And honestly, if this feature is not available in public cloud, it makes little sense to have a customizing point where you can activate a flag to trigger the dialog. Best regards.

entry.title: How to Create a Generic Business Partner
entry.content:
How to mass create a generic Business Partner with either Business Partner applications or via the Migration Cockpit without any specific customer/supplier role. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Create a Generic Business Partner
entry.content:
Hi, 

 

It is not possible to create a generic business partner via the Migration Cockpit app either by the Staging Table approach or Direct Transfer as the business partner must have a role. This is clearly defined in the Help Portal for both approaches-

  • Business partner | SAP Help Portal - Direct Transfer
  • Customer | SAP Help Portal - Staging Table
  • Supplier | SAP Help Portal - Staging Table

 

The 'Manage Mass Maintenance â€“ Business Partner' application can be used to update a preexisting Business Partner but it cannot be used to create a Business Partner. More information is available here: Creating and Editing a Mass Process | SAP Help Portal. 

 

In order to create a generic Business Partner please use the 'Manage Business Partners' application for individual Business Partners. More information is available here: Creating a Business Partner | SAP Help Portal .

 

If you wish to mass create Business Partners please use this documentation: Business Partner Integration | SAP Help Portal.

 

Thanks, 

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: #CoE#GB Movement type 107/109 Question
entry.content:
Dear @TzuYunHung,

For Public Cloud the recommended solution is not to modify standard movement types 107/109 but to create custom (copied) movement types and use them only where your special behavior is needed

My recommended approach in Public Cloud

  • Keep 107/109 unchanged (protects future inbound-delivery / warehousing usage)

MVT 107/109 as core standard. This avoids unintended impact on scenarios that may later rely on the standard control of these movement types.

  • Create Z movement types as copies in CBC

In Public Cloud you do this via Copy of Movement Type (103898). During the copy you overwrite to a new movement type

 

SAP Note below for Troubleshooting and documentation:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003090694

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003109898

 

Be aware of limitations in CBC for example some texts/links or reversal/follow-on relationships may be restricted

  • Enable the custom movement types in the GR Fiori apps via Badi

After creating the copied movement types, SAP requires implementing the Badi MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA so the custom movement type can actually be used in the GR apps for purchasing document / inbound delivery scenarios

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/9ddf815494758c4ce10000000a4450e5.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/4c2ebb48c8044502acf588e14783bbc8.html

and if you need additional checks/validations, you typically complement with MMIM_GR4XY_CHECK_DATA

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/df404e3e691f44eabd3fa2ee0412010d.html

  • Know the scope custom movement types are not supported everywhere

In Public Cloud not every Fiori goods movement app lets you switch to a custom movement type and SAP has Note describing such limitations

More details below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002553216

Some movement type related fields can be non-editable in CBC and may require an expert configuration request and field selection may conflict with FI field status for example shown in SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003673901

Summary:

In Public Cloud the clean/core/cloud-friendly solution is:

  • Do not change 107/109
  • Copy to custom movement types
  • Use the Badi MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA to make the custom types usable in the relevant GR apps
  • Keep standard 107/109 available for any future inbound-delivery / warehousing dependent processes

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) | Customer Roundtable | December 2025
entry.content:
Customer Roundtable

As we approach the end of 2025, it's time for our final CAP Customer Roundtable of the year. This event is a good opportunity to reflect on recent developments, share insights, and address topics that matter most to the CAP community. As always, we will go for a mix of recent announcements, demos, presentations as well as topics and questions raised by the CAP community.

Do you have any CAP related insights, requirements, issues, challenges, topics, â€¦ that you would like to share and discuss in the upcoming meeting? If yes, please reach-out to us so that we can add it to the agenda.

 

 

Agenda

  1. Introduction
  2. Updates from CAP Team
    • New Assert Annotation
    • Status Transition Flows
    • Data Integration
  3. Q&A / Topics by the Community

 

Meeting Information

When: Wednesday, December 17th, 2025, 10 AM CET

Where:  Teams Meeting

Meeting Request Download: link

Who:  

    • All interested partners and stakeholders are invited to join: developers, enterprise architects, technical consultantsâ€¦
    • The SAP Cloud Application Programming Model team
    • Anyone interested in learning about the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and exchanging ideas and feedback with other users and the product team

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Also check out the new Events page in our documentation and our Community page for updates on upcoming events.

entry.title: How I Escaped Browser Tab Hell: A Lesson in Choosing the Right AI Tool
entry.content:
The Journey

The Problem: 10 Years of Digital Hoarding

After a decade at SAP, I was drowning in resources. My solution? Browser bookmarks that grew into an unmanageable mess. When Chrome introduced Tab Groups, I thought I'd found salvationâ€”until I realized I was maintaining 200+ tabs across multiple groups. The anxiety from my digital FOMO was worse than ever.

Back to Basics (With a Twist)

I returned to curated bookmarks but with a new goal: create a "PM Toolbox" that I could easily maintain *and* share with colleagues across the organization. I built a clean bookmark folder and mirrored it on a wiki page.

The Maintenance Nightmare

Within weeks, reality hit: my bookmark folder evolved constantly, requiring manual wiki updates. Chrome's bookmark export format (the ancient Netscape standard) made extracting subsets error-prone and frustrating. I needed automation.

First Attempt: GenAI Fails the Coding Test

I tried using Claude 4.5 Sonnet through GenAI-XL. Despite multiple attempts, it couldn't handle Chrome's non-standard HTML format. It kept reaching for HTML parsing libraries that failed, then suggested an obscure Netscape parser that violated SAP standards. Dead end.

Second Attempt: GitHub Copilot Nails It

The next day, I switched to VSCode with GitHub Copilot. Here's what changed:
  1. I wrote clear requirements in a `.github/copilot-instructions.md` file, specifically calling out the Netscape format complexity
  2. Copilot enhanced my requirements, suggesting testing coverage and documentation guidelines (80% of the final instructions came from Copilot)
  3. I switched to Agent mode and prompted: *"Please create the missing files. Do not reference public code in your response."* (Critical for enterprise compliance)
The result? A complete, working scriptâ€”instantly.

But it got better. When I asked for a second script to generate Confluence tables, Copilot:
  • Created the implementation
  • Built the test suite when I requested it
  • Ran the tests autonomously, discovered bugs, and fixed themâ€”all without me asking
I was genuinely amazed.

Key Takeaways

1. Match the Tool to the Task

  • General AI (like Claude): Excellent for brainstorming, requirements refinement, and PM tasks
  • Specialized coding AI (like GitHub Copilot): Purpose-built for implementation and testing

2. Clear Requirements Are Non-Negotiable

Both attempts used AI, but only the second succeeded because I provided structured, detailed requirements upfront.

3. Embrace Test-Driven Development

Even with AI assistance, automated testing is essential. Copilot's self-correction only worked because tests exposed the bugs immediately.

4. Simple Solutions Often Win

Sometimes the answer isn't a shinier toolâ€”it's going back to basics (curated bookmarks) with smart automation layered on top.

The Bottom Line

AI coding assistants aren't magicâ€”they're power tools. Like any tool, they require the right context, clear instructions, and quality controls. When you provide those, the results can be transformative.

For PMs and non-developers: you don't need to be a coder to automate your work. You just need to understand your requirements so you can clearly write them down and choose the AI tool designed for the job.

References

You can find the scripts in question here

entry.title: Winter Wonderland - 3 Projects for the Winter and Holiday Season
entry.content:
Here youâ€™ll find three winter and holiday themed projects for beginners and more advanced learners.
The resources are suitable for workshops in informal learning settings or for independent study periods.

The videos are step by step tutorials that show you how to build the projects. Especially the digital greeting card and the snowflake generator, can then be customized individually.

 

Introduction to Snap! and saving projects

If this is your first time programming with Snap!, take a look at this introductory video: 
https://youtu.be/cbRQ7nGqWLo?si=WSEAK6xuYk3HfAeR 

There youâ€™ll get an overview of how to program with Snap! and how to save your projects and share them with others.

Saving and sharing are also explained in more detail on this activity card:
https://dam.sap.com/mac/u/a/FY7NHCt?rc=10&doi=SAP1261708 

 

Project 1: Writing Home for Christmas - Create your Digital Greeting Card

The first project is well suited for Snap! beginners. Using animations and graphic effects, you will build a digital interactive greeting card.

The examples use Christmas-themed winter motives, but if your Christmas isn't in winter or you're celebrating other holidays, feel free to adjust the project accordingly. 

Result of a digital greeting card: Alonzo jumps when he is clicked. A yeti changes its costume several times when it is entered by the mouse pointer. When the space bar is pressed, â€œMerry Christmasâ€ is written on the stage in a random color. In the background you can see a snowy landscape and a Christmas tree.Result of another digital greeting card: A sprig of holly jumps when clicked. The yeti changes costumes, adjusts its size, and applies a graphic effect when it is clicked. The snowflake spins and gets smaller when clicked. Above it, â€œMerry Christmasâ€ is written. In the background you can see a snowy landscape.

Follow the video tutorial to create your own digital greeting card:
https://youtu.be/cbRQ7nGqWLo?si=k_W5D3fZ5PFwZBhf&t=691 

Read the activity cards (pages 3 to 6) to understand the individual ideas shown in the video (animation through multiple costumes, animation through multiple movements, playing sounds, adding backgrounds): 
https://dam.sap.com/mac/u/a/FY7NHCt?rc=10&doi=SAP1261708

Take a look at the solution project from the video tutorial:
https://snap.berkeley.edu/snap/snap.html#present:Username=jadga&ProjectName=Project%20Winterwonderland 

 

Project 2: Let It Snow! - Build an Interactive Snow Globe

In this project, an interactive digital snow globe is created using clones of a snowflake sprite. The swarm of snowflakes can be controlled via the microphone volume or the tilt sensors of a mobile device.

Result of the snow globe project

The snowflakes are clones that follow a lead flake, which moves forward at a certain speed and bounces off the edge. This speed slightly decreases after each movement. A loud noise (microphone volume > 50), such as blowing into the microphone, resets the speed to its maximum value.

In this video, the project is built step by step so you can code along:
https://youtu.be/cbRQ7nGqWLo?si=DoYeP45clUr3rwj1&t=1869 

These activity cards contain the individual steps for review (starting on page 7):
https://dam.sap.com/mac/u/a/FY7NHCt?rc=10&doi=SAP1261708 

 

Control via a mobile device

In addition to the microphone, the speed can also be controlled using the tilt sensors of a smartphone or tablet.
To access these sensors, the "Mobile Device Sensors" library must be loaded first. It contains only one block, which provides access to the tilt sensors. The x and y tilts correspond to the axes on the Snap! stage â€” that is, the x component measures the tilt to the left and right, and the y component measures the forward and backward tilt. The tilt block (right) can be loaded via the file menu â†’ Libraries (left). It can be found in the "Mobile Device Sensors" library.

Instead of resetting the "wind" variable based on the microphone volume to speed the snowflakes up again, you can also use the tilt of a phone or tablet. The following script sets â€œwindâ€ to 30 whenever the device is tilted more than 45Â° to the left or right (which corresponds to a tilt of more than 50 or less than â€“50 in the x-direction).

This script shows how the "wind" variable can be reset via the tilt of a mobile device.

This way you can control the snowflakes with your mobile phone: 
The snow globe is activated with a right tilt of the phone.

This solution project contains the code for controlling the snow globe via the microphone and the tilt sensor of mobile devices:
https://snap.berkeley.edu/snap/snap.html#present:Username=jadga&ProjectName=SnowGlobe-EN 

 

Project 3: Snowflake Designer

In this project, the cut from block in Snap! is literally the star of the show. It allows us to cut triangles in such a way that, when stamped and mirrored multiple times, they create these beautiful, star-shaped snowflakes.

5 snowflakes which were created using the Snowflake Designer. The first three snowflakes have a hexagon as their basic shape, the forth one is created from a square, the last on from a decagon.

This video tutorial guides you through the programming process for the Snowflake Designer step by step: 
https://youtu.be/zIMTxhrpkKQ?si=Klw0U9f57sZU3Zp8 

With this solution project you can check your results or test the program:
https://snap.berkeley.edu/snap/snap.html#present:Username=jadga&ProjectName=Snowflake-Designer-EN 

The solution project is a generalized version of the Snowflake Designer. Here, the generated triangle can be adjusted using the â€œpointsâ€ variable so that, after unfolding, a polygon with the corresponding number of vertices is created.

To do this, the code must be adapted in the following places:

In the paper object, the distance covered with the "move" block after turning the sprite depends on the number stored in the â€œpointsâ€ variable. Accordingly, the other angles of the triangle adjust automatically:
Three triangles drawn depending on the â€œpointsâ€ variable. The input to the tan of block is (360Â° / points) / 2.

If the triangle has different dimensions, the number of repetitions and the rotation angle must also be adjusted in the script that â€œunfoldsâ€ the triangle to form the polygon. The number of repeats equals the desired number of points, and the rotation angle is 360Â° / points.

On the left, you can see the script for â€œunfoldingâ€ the triangle. The number of repeats and the rotation angle are defined based on the â€œpointsâ€ variable. On the right, you can see the results of this script â€” the resulting polygons when â€œpointsâ€ is set to 4 or 6.

 

Have fun trying the projects â¤ï¸ğŸ„â„ï¸ğŸŒŸ

entry.title: Re: Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience
entry.content:
Hi john,

It should work for any cloud product except Concur

2518600 - How does a customer invite partner S-user IDs to create cases on their behalf using the Service Partner User functionality - SAP for Me - SAP for Me

The customer first invites the partner, then the partner accepts, then (a step often omitted) the customer sets a validity on the invitation, then assigns authorizations

(customer must be cloud admin)

So it is likely an issue with missing validity date  or missing authorization.

You can reach out to CIC if this still does not work and create a case for SAP for Me (XX-SER-FORME), they will assist.

entry.title: Re: Unable to update Journal Entry Line with KOART value "D"
entry.content:
Hello @JastinC1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following reference.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/6350d7531a4d424de10000000a174cb4.html?locale=en-US

The public cloud does not allow updating the Reference1ByBusinessPartner field on journal entry lines with KOART=D because changes to customer lines are restricted. Instead, you should reverse the original document and repost a corrected entry. These restrictions are to enforce compliance in the audit framework.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Processing of Purchase Requisition
entry.content:
Dear @Matt42,

What you are seeing is standard behavior in Public Cloud:

  • My Purchase Requisitions New intentionally allows users to edit PRs even after a follow-on document exists (PO created). SAP explicitly calls this a new feature of the new SSP app

More detail below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3498391

 

  • PR->PO conversion is not designed as 1:1. SAP own training material states that you may create one or several POs, depending on supplier / purchasing org / purchasing group, etc.

 

Answer 1. Best practice control (no hard lock)

  • Use in CBC: Manage Conditions to Restart Flexible Workflow
  • For more complex rules (by plant, company code, etc.), use Badi MM_PUR_S4_PR_WFL_RESTART (Define of Conditions to Restart Flexible Workflow in Purchase Requisitions)

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2775709

Hard lock, what you asked for, block edits once release is completed

SAP workaround recommendation is:

  • Implement Badi MM_PUR_S4_PR_MODIFY_ITEM
  • Read the original approval/release status from I_PurchaseRequisitionItemAPI01, field PurReqnReleaseStatus
  • If itâ€™s already release completed, raise an error message and stop the change
  • You should check PurReqnReleaseStatus status, not FRGKZ/FRGST

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3498391

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/a25472838bd846e3992586e16c230794.html

Answer 2. Not allow another PO from same PR

There are two different problems that can often mix:

  1. Header status is aggregated that can mean some items have follow-on docs, other items may still be legitimately convertible hence SAP allows creating another PO
  2. Even for the same item, SAP can still allow another PO if thereâ€™s still open quantity/value (partial ordering) or if your process allows splitting.

For point 1. SAP provides a direct workaround:

  • Implement Badi MM_PUR_S4_PR_CHECK
  • Check field PROCESSINGSTATUS, if it indicates follow-on exists, raise an error

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3498391

For point 2. Enforce only one PO per PR

There is no standard customizing switch to force 1:1, but you can enforce it with a PO check Badi:

  • Implement Badi BD_MMPUR_FINAL_CHECK_PO and reject saving if the referenced PR already has a different PO.

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3544706

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Implementation and Customizing of Real-Time Instant P...
entry.content:
To enable Instant Payments in SAP ERP 6.0, you will primarily need to configure the Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) for specific instant payment formats, potentially integrate with SAP Bank Communication Management (BCM) or SAP Payment Engine, and refer to SAP Notes like: SAP Notes 2530182  and SAP Notes 2386927 

which provide foundational guidance on SEPA Instant Credit Transfer, though mainly focused on S/4HANA.
 
If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks, Denis

entry.content:
Hi Zupa,

I had exactly the same problem with the oData V4 'CE_BILLINGDOCUMENT_0001:v1' API.

entry.title: Re: The Data Service Request is required to be conditiona...
entry.content:
I could not make the ODATA V4 to work, so I used HTTPS instead.
For anybody facing the same issue, this is how I did it. 

Step 1: 

Step 2:

GET call:
.../sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_billingdocument/srvd_a2x/sap/billingdocument/0001/$metadata

Step3: 

Step 4: 

GET call:
..../sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_billingdocument/srvd_a2x/sap/billingdocument/0001/BillingDocument
$select=BillingDocument&$filter=BillingDocument eq '${property.Billing_Document}'

Step 5:

Step 6:
JSON to XML

Step 7:


+ Create the Body for the PACTH call

Step 8:

PATCH call:
.../sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_billingdocument/srvd_a2x/sap/billingdocument/0001/BillingDocument/${property.Billing_Document}

entry.title: Learning Hub - passed exam but did not receive digital badge
entry.content:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I have already opened two tickets on the learning hub ticket center (5000249512; 5000256720) regarding the issue that, although I successfully passed the exam on the Learning Hub and have proof of completion, the Learning Hub still shows that I failed the exam.

My previous ticket was forwarded to the technical team for resolution, but it has now been over 2 weeks without any progress. Therefore I hope that someone from the Learning Hub team sees this post and escalates my issue to the relevant team for fix so I can hopefully receive my digital badge.

 

BR

entry.title: Configuration from Sales Order not Copied to Purchase Order
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

We have a configurable material.

The configurable material is not produced, but purchased from a supplier.

We require the same configuration in the purchase order as in the sales order.

However, the configuration from the sales order is not copied to the purchase order.

What could be the cause?

Thanks in advance,

 

Floyd

entry.title: Failed to post Physical Inventory Document due to unknown reconciliation issue Code: M7059
entry.content:
We are trying to post Physical Inventory Document which failed. We have checked Account Auto-Determination, and make sure that GBB is assigned to account DIGITS.

Diagnosis

No direct postings can be made to the G/L account (because it is a reconciliation account).

System Response

The system cannot post the amount to this account.

Procedure

If the system has determined the G/L account, the system setting is faulty. Contact your systems administrator.

If you have entered the G/L account manually, enter a different account or cancel the account entered, so that the system determines an account automatically.

Message no. M7059

 

When we view account in app Manage G/L Account Master we cannot see assignment to reconciliation account. 

 

 

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Failed to post Physical Inventory Document due to unk...
entry.content:
You can use App Display G/L Account changes  to see changes on account. You can see if account Group was changed. 

The screen layout for an account group determines which fields are relevant for that group. Suppress/Hidden fields are not displayed in app Manage G/L Account Master for accounts.  It is necessary to change the Account Group back to display fields relevant for prior account group if these fields not relevant for current account group assigned. 

see 3690363 Error raised on G/L Account during posting

entry.title: Question about Data Products with Live Access in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Iâ€™m working with a Data Product that is based on a live connection (Delivery Mode: Live Access). When a user installs this Data Product in a space, the user receives a view.
However, when the underlying view changes, these changes are not reflected in the installed Data Product.

My question:
Is it possible for a Data Product using Live Access to automatically pick up changes made to the underlying view?
If yes, how can this be achieved?

From what I understand, â€œEdit Releaseâ€ only applies to Data Products using Full Replication, not Live Access.

Any insights would be greatly appreciated, this would really help me.

Thanks and best regards

entry.title: Re: Simplify Deployment and Monitoring with the CAP Console
entry.content: Currently you only have the option to provide your own BTP CLI URL, but you can not configure a custom IDP. We'll add this to our backlog ğŸ‘

entry.title: How can we print a cancelled FINT Invoice. (SAP ECC6)
entry.content: Our customers sometimes renegotiate their terms, and in such cases we need to cancel the Interest Invoice. However, because they have already processed the original Interest Invoice on their side, they require a cancellation invoice in order to record the reversal correctly.

entry.title: Re: Can anyone explain what is ORT in sap.
entry.content: in context of SAP Support and SLA "ORT" stands for "Ongoing Response Time"

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Logging Service (CLS) API access
entry.content: We fully acknowledge the benefit of OpenSearch API access. However based on our initial investigation it requires additional perquisites to be implemented before security standard approves it - which we schedule to work on H2,2026 (validating OIDC/JWT/Cert based auth in addition to just basic auth, user roles management with reduced scope and shared responsibility for effects of using of the APIs)

entry.title: Re: SAP HANA SQLScript: calculate working days between days
entry.content:
Hello,
You can use the function Workdays_Between in SQLScript.
You can see an example with
table function P_MaintOrderDurationInWorkdays
implemented by method cl_eam_fact_calendar_amdp=>determine_order_durations
Regards

entry.title: Re: Calendar Transactions SFHC_FCAL, SFHC_HCAL, SFCH_HOL...
entry.content:
Hello,
You can use it with the function Workdays_Between in SQLScript
You can see an example with
table function P_MaintOrderDurationInWorkdays
implemented by method cl_eam_fact_calendar_amdp=>determine_order_durations
Regards

entry.title: Re: Manage group to team assignments for SAC within Ident...
entry.content:
Hi @renejurmann 

We have discussed this earlier in the community and I think is much easier to configure the group assignments via SAML this is explained in detail in the learning with some AS Java system, but the idea is the same using CIS. This is much simpler than provisioning the users via IPS.

As a general rule for IPS to avoid overwriting users or assignments we usually have a PATCH operation available as part of the SCIM protocol. If you check in the documentation https://help.sap.com/docs/identity-provisioning/identity-provisioning/target-sap-analytics-cloud you'll see a note refering to the parameter "sac.support.patch.operation" and the exact issue you're facing with role removals.

In terms fo the transformation if the groups only differ beacause of the value "_dev_"  I'd look for just one replace string function to alwas replace "_dev" with "" (empty value)

entry.title: Pattern funtion for RFC
entry.content:
SAP has many functionalities that simplify coders. But We didn't sometimes find a simple requirement. This is one of them. Pattern for RFCs. Here the solution of steps.

All of ABAP coders know and like Patterns. But there is not a simple way to put RFC functions.

Here the solution:

1- Define Custom Pattern 

Follow SE38->Utilities->More Utilities->Edit Pattern  node and define a new one with the name "

 

2- We will create a function in both systems. First below code is for source system which will call target RFC. Function name should start with the name of pattern Z_RFC_FUNCTION and follow EDITOR_EXIT So it's : Z_RFC_FUNCTION_EDITOR_EXIT.

You will see I'm calling a function which will return required source code for RFC call at the line of 31. Of course you should change the DESTINATION with your system rfc. 

FUNCTION z_rfc_function_editor_exit.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  TABLES
*"      BUFFER TYPE  RSWSOURCET
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
  DATA lt_sval TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sval.
  DATA ls_sval TYPE sval.

  DATA: buffer2 TYPE rswsourcet.

* Get name of structure from user
  ls_sval-tabname = 'RS38L'.
  ls_sval-fieldname = 'NAME'.
  ls_sval-field_attr  = '00'.
  APPEND ls_sval TO lt_sval.

  CALL FUNCTION 'POPUP_GET_VALUES'
    EXPORTING
      popup_title     = 'Enter Function Name'
    TABLES
      fields          = lt_sval
    EXCEPTIONS
      error_in_fields = 1
      OTHERS          = 2.

* Get the given structure name
  READ TABLE lt_sval INTO ls_sval INDEX 1.
  check ls_sval-value is not INITIAL.

  CALL FUNCTION 'Z_RFC_FUNCTION_EDITOR_EXIT'
    DESTINATION 'KHDCLNT100'
    EXPORTING
      funcname = ls_sval-value
    IMPORTING
      buffer   = buffer2.

  LOOP AT buffer2 INTO DATA(ls_buffer).

    APPEND ls_buffer TO buffer.

  ENDLOOP.
ENDFUNCTION.

3- Second is for target system which RFC will be run. I gave the same name for the function to get the source code from target system. Here it's Z_RFC_FUNCTION_EDITOR_EXIT.

FUNCTION z_rfc_function_editor_exit.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     VALUE(FUNCNAME) TYPE  RS38L-NAME
*"  EXPORTING
*"     VALUE(BUFFER) TYPE  RSWSOURCET
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  DATA: l_pattern_obj TYPE REF TO cl_sedi_pattern_generator,
        l_pattern     TYPE swbse_max_line_tab,
        l_pattern_new TYPE swbse_max_line_tab.

  DATA: lv_line TYPE LINE OF swbse_max_line_tab.

  CREATE OBJECT l_pattern_obj
    EXPORTING
      i_column  = 0
      i_include = CONV #( 'ZTESTYK' ).

  l_pattern_obj->built_function(
             EXPORTING
               i_function_name = CONV #( funcname )
             IMPORTING
               e_pattern       = l_pattern ).
  LOOP AT l_pattern INTO lv_line.

    APPEND lv_line TO l_pattern_new.

    IF lv_line CP 'CALL FUNCTION*'.
      APPEND 'DESTINATION ''KHDCLNT100''' TO l_pattern_new.
    ENDIF.


  ENDLOOP.

  buffer[] = l_pattern_new.

ENDFUNCTION.

And it's coming to test ğŸ™‚

You will simply select other pattern and it will ask function name.

Just put the RFC function name.

Here it comes.

Also i suggest doing the below settings for better editorial.

Cheers ykburda ğŸ™‚

entry.title: Guidance on Global Settlement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud PS
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are currently implementing the Project System (PS) module for one of our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud customers, and weâ€™ve encountered an issue during the global settlement process.

Our scenario starts with creating an investment project using the â€œProyectos empresarialesâ€ app (scope item 1NT). The project already has actual costs posted to a WBS element, and an investment profile is assigned. This profile automatically creates a settlement rule to an Asset under Construction (AuC) â€” and this part works perfectly.

The settlement to the AuC runs successfully, and the settlement rule is generated automatically as expected.

However, the issue arises when performing the final (global) settlement to the completed fixed asset. The system throws an error message, preventing us from completing the process. Weâ€™ve attached a screenshot showing the exact system message.

We would like to understand:

  • What is the root cause of this issue â€” is it related to configuration, process steps, or a standard restriction in SAP S/4HANA Cloud PS?

  • What are the standard steps and prerequisites to perform a successful final settlement to a fixed asset within the SAP Cloud PS standard process?

We have been analyzing this behavior for several days but havenâ€™t been able to identify a solution. Any insights or guidance from the community would be greatly appreciated.

If any specific details are needed (e.g., Project ID, WBS element, client/mandante), Iâ€™ll be glad to provide them.

Thank you in advance for your support and contributions!

Best regards,

â€ƒ

â€ƒ

â€ƒ

entry.title: Re: SAC error "We couldn't connect to your BW system"
entry.content:
Hi there

I was experiencing the exact same issue  with SAC story based on BW live model. Just found out that the problem was related to user settings in BW: somehow the "contractual user type ID" (SU01) was changed and that was the causing the issue. Also a hint, if that is not your exact problem: check authorization data in BW SU53 for the user. And if you ask colleagues to delete Cache, then they might get a pop-up for allowing cloud connection, and it is important to allow this. 

Cheers,

AndrÃ©

entry.title: Can we connect Actual On Premise DataBase to Cloud ALM (Apart from ABAP system)
entry.content:
We understand that Cloud ALM will be focused for Cloud Systems. 

We have customers that still have on premise Systems, and we have successfully linked them to the Cloud ALM (ABAP instances) and can see some Database metrics under Health Monitoring. 

The question is: Is it possible to link the actual Database to ALM also (apart from the ABAP system), to see even more DB monitoring tools that is beyond the ABAP system health Monitoring and the few monitors we see there?

My understanding is that SAP in Future want all clients in cloud, and then Databases will be monitored by SAP with some inhouse systems and there might not be a need for a client to monitor the DB themselves, but until such time there is clients who might like to see more on-premise Database type monitors.

- Things like "is backups running on DATABASE"

- Has database backups run successfully / or not.

 

(Sorry if using wrong terminology - language thing.)

entry.title: Remove lines in fields
entry.content:
I'm trying to modify a report in our ERP software (with Crystal Reports 2016). In the attached screen shot I have 3 lines circled. Is it possible to remove these lines or have N/A automatically inserted based on the the value in the WC/Vendor field (on the left of screenshot where it says "QC PLAN")? We have many WC's (work centers) that don't require the "Man 1st PC", "CMM 1st PC", and "Completed" fields filled out. What we've done in the past is the engineer hand writes in N/A when they aren't needed but it's a lot of work. If we can remove those lines based on the value in the WC filed, or have N/A put in automatically it would save a lot of work and time.

Thanks.

entry.title: Integrating ABAP system with SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi! We want to use SAP Build Apps to create a full-stack application using ABAP (ADT-Eclipse) as backend, but we can't create a communication arrangement. We've tried multiple approaches, such as:  

-Using the shared account provided through the e-learning materials

-Using a free trial personal BTP account

-Connecting to a private cloud/on-premise system via the Cloud Connector.

Unfortunately, each approach resulted in connection issues that we could not resolve. Given the current circumstances, we presume that regardless of the approach, we need to have access to an ABAP-on-Cloud instance in which admin roles are granted to me. 

This is what our ABAP instance dashboard shows: 

We've followed several tutorials, and we think we should have an Administrator tile and also, when we search Communication in the app finder, we only get System Outbound Communication as result.

We'd greatly appreciate any tips or guidance.
